He declared that the country is aligning climate action with energy access, economic growth, and social development . Title: Owo Catholic Church Attack: Court admits exhibits as more witnesses testify
Summary: Court admits exhibits as more witnesses testify against five defendants put on trial by the Department of State Service . The five defendants are accused of masterminding the June 5, 2022 terror attacks against the Saint Francis Savier Catholic Church in Owo town, Ondo .

Title: FG flags off Lagos gold refinery, readies $600m lithium plant in Nasarawa
Summary: Federal Government announces start of operations at high-purity gold refinery in Lagos . $600m lithium processing plant in Nasarawa State is ready for commissioning, signalling a push to deepen local processing in Nigeria’s mining industry .

Title: Tinubu says Nigeria’s carbon market can generate $3b per year
Summary: President Bola Tinubu says Nigeria’s carbon market can generate $3b per year . Nigeria is positioning its newly activated carbon market to generate between $2.5bn and $3bn annually over the next decade . The move is part of efforts to mobilise climate finance and support the country's energy transition .

Title: FG flags off construction of police rank-and-file quarters in Enugu
Summary: Federal Government has flagged off the construction of a six-man rank-and-file residential quarters for police personnel at Ozalla, Nkanu West Local Government Area of Enugu State, as part of efforts to improve the welfare and operational efficiency of the police .

Title: Kebbi govt reopens Maga school after abduction of 24 schoolgirls
Summary: Kebbi govt reopens Maga school after abduction of 24 schoolgirls . Governor Nasir Idris has directed that all necessary security measures be put in place .

Title: Trump tells Iranians ‘help on its way’, as crackdown toll soars
Summary: US President Trump urged Iranians to keep protesting against the country's theocratic leadership . He told them "help is on its way" as crackdown toll soars .

Title: Shettima, Oshiomhole, Gbaja, Akume close ranks on reform
Summary: Vice President Kashim Shettima urged public servants to anchor their work on discipline, selflessness and excellence . He said lasting legacies in governance are built through consistency, resilience and strength of character .

Title: World Bank projects steady global growth in spite of uncertainties
Summary: World Bank projects steady global growth in spite of uncertainties . The bank said this in its latest Global Economic Prospects report, released on Tuesday . It projects global growth to remain broadly steady over the next two years .

Title: Anambra releases ₦15.9bn for Onitsha–Aguleri dual carriageway project
Summary: The Anambra State Government has approved the release of ₦15.96 billion for the dualisation of the dilapidated Onitsha–Aguleri Road in the Anambura North Senatorial Zone .
